evs.data.fileio
Class OHDFileIO

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.FileIO
      evs.data.fileio.OHDFileIO
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputDataIO
public class OHDFileIO
extends FileIO
implements InputDataIO

ALL TIME ZONES IN THIS CLASS MUST RETURN INTEGER OFFSETS IN MILLISECONDS RELATIVE TO UTC FROM getRawOffset(). note: this java method reports to use values in hours but actually requires milliseconds. A wrapper class for reading NOAA OHD files of the Datacard type and ESP binary files and returning paired forecasts and observations with corresponding times in UTC milliseconds from the epoch. The time zones of the forecasts and observations may be specified or are otherwise assumed to be in UTC.

Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

Method Detail

readObservations

public static java.util.Vector<DoubleMatrix2D> readObservations(java.io.File[] input,
                                                                int fileType,
                                                                ConditionArray conditions,
                                                                double nV)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
Reads in an array of files containing observations and returns a vector of matrices, which may be input to the pairing process. Each matrix contains the data from one file. The first column contains the time in hours from the epoch and the remaining columns contain the data. The data should be in OHD Datacard format. This method assumes that the data are already in UTC time. See below for a method with a specified time zone.

Parameters:
input - the input data
fileType - the file type
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
nV - the null value
Returns:
vector of matrices
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                                                                double nV)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
Reads in an array of files and returns a vector of matrices, which may be input to the pairing process. See the constructor above also. This constructor allows an explicit time zone if not the default UTC.

Parameters:
input - the data
timeZone - the time zone with integer offset from UTC
fileType - the file type
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
nV - the null value

the a vector of matrices containing the data

readForecasts

public static java.util.Vector<DoubleMatrix2D> readForecasts(java.io.File[] input,
                                                             int fileType,
                                                             ConditionArray conditions,
                                                             double nV)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
Reads in an array of files containing forecasts and returns a vector of matrices, which may be input to the pairing process. Each matrix contains the data from one file. The first column contains the time in hours from the epoch, the second column contains the forecast lead time in hours and the remaining columns contain the data. The data should be in OHD Datacard format or ESP binary format. This method assumes that the data are already in UTC time. See below for a constructor with an alternative time zone.

Parameters:
input - the input data
fileType - the file type
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
nV - the null value
Returns:
vector of matrices
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readForecasts

public static java.util.Vector<DoubleMatrix2D> readForecasts(java.io.File[] input,
                                                             java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                                             ConditionArray conditions,
                                                             int fileType,
                                                             double nV)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
Reads in an array of files and returns a vector of matrices, which may be input to the pairing process. See the constructor above also. This constructor allows an explicit time zone if not the default UTC. If required, specify a maximum forecast lead time in hours relative to the start time or null.

Parameters:
input - the data
timeZone - the time zone with integer offset from UTC
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
fileType - the file type
nV - the null value
Returns:
the a vector of matrices

java.io.IOException

public static DoubleMatrix2D readDatacardObservedFile(java.io.File file,
                                                      java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                                      ConditionArray conditions,
                                                      double nV)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
Processes a Datacard file of observations and returns a 2D matrix of values with their corresponding times in UTC hours from the epoch using the specified time zone to determine any offset.

Parameters:
file - the file to read
timeZone - the time zone with integer offset from UTC
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
nV - the null value
Returns:
the observations
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readDatacardForecastFile

public static DoubleMatrix2D readDatacardForecastFile(java.io.File file,
                                                      java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                                      ConditionArray conditions,
                                                      double nV)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
Processes a Datacard file and returns a 2D matrix of values with their corresponding times in UTC hours from the epoch using the specified time zone to determine any offset. The matrix contains dates in the first column and ensemble members in the remaining columns. Each column then corresponds to a specific ensemble trace. If required, specify a maximum forecast lead time in hours relative to the start time or null. TODO: implement the lead time constraints in the ohd file readers

Parameters:
file - the file to read
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
timeZone - the time zone with integer offset from UTC
nV - the null value
Returns:
the forecasts
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readESPBinaryFile

public static DoubleMatrix2D readESPBinaryFile(java.io.File file,
                                               java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                               ConditionArray conditions,
                                               boolean skipZoneCheck,
                                               double nV)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Processes an ESP binary file and returns a 2D matrix of values with their corresponding times in UTC hours from the epoch using the specified time zone to determine any offset. The matrix contains dates in the first column, forecast lead times in the second column (if applicable) and ensemble members in the remaining columns (or a vector of, for example, streamflow simulations). For ensemble forecasts, each column corresponds to a specific ensemble trace. If required, specify a maximum forecast lead time in hours relative to the start time or null. TODO: implement the lead time constraints in the ohd file readers

Parameters:
file - the file to read
timeZone - the time zone with integer offset from UTC
conditions - an array of conditions upon which to restrict reading (may be null)
skipZoneCheck - is true to avoid checking the input time zone for equality with the time zone offset from UTC on file, which otherwise throws an exception if incompatible
nV - the null value
Returns:
the forecasts
Throws:
java.io.IOException
